profileText: A Representative from Connecticut; born in Waterbury, Conn., July 11, 1810; attended the common schools; engaged in manufacturing pursuits; mayor of Waterbury in 1852; member of the State house of representatives in 1851 and 1858; elected as a Democrat to the Fortieth Congress (March 4, 1867-March 3, 1869); Lieutenant Governor of Connecticut in 1870; died in Middletown, Conn., December 23, 1878; interment in Pine Grove Cemetery.

researchRecord.name: In the Elliot Savage Papers, 1870, 8 pages.
researchRecord.description: An agreement of Elliot Savage and Julius Hotchkiss and the Meriden Britannia Company from March 21, 1870. The agreement gives exclusive licence to the Meriden Britannia Company to manufacture and vend a new alloy called manganese silver. The agreement also includes a draft of a notice from Hotchkiss and Savage revoking the agreement.
